content: froggybug spherical eggs needles 1 circular needle and/or a set of 4 double pointed needles i use needles that are 0 5 to 1mm thinner than size recommended on ball band yarn i usually use sock yarn and 2-2 5mm needles i would highly recommend to use black as secondary colour the time i used a fair colour the lines looked as long scars gauge using the trapping-the-floats-at-each-stitch technic 20 stitches x 20 row = 55 mm width x 45 mm height the gauge is not as important as the proportion 55 / 45 i am insisting about using the trapping-the-floats-at-each-stitch technique as it changes the width / height proportions dramatically and keeps the fabric tight and rigid enough techniques abbreviations explained in this pattern dpn double point needle trapping the floats at each stitch st stitch colorwork knitting it creates a k knit lovely pattern on the kb knit from the back yarn of the loop monochrome parts s slip purl-wise knit in the round skpo single decrease slip_stitch purl wise knit the next stitch pass the slipped stitch i-cord cast off explained in this over pattern sk2togpo double-decrease slip_stitch purl wise knit the two next stitches together pass the slipped stitch over yb yarn on the back yf yarn on the front yo yarn over process high level description the spheres have a slot in the middle on 2/5 of the length so that octopus / chameleon and other froggybug s soft toy can comfortably sleep inside the sphere is made of 5 identical curved slices progressing together delimited by the secondary colour lines on the picture i d highly recommend to use black or a very dark colour as secondary colour those lines can be used as markers all decreases are just before that line the knitting is all in the round starting from the bottom with 10 stitches each row is repeating the same sequence 5 times for each of the 5 slices the slice pattern is designed so that from the beginning to the end each slice starts with a yarn over using the secondary colour then depending on the part of the sphere the work is there will be either none one or two decreased stitches at the end of the slice see parts delimitations on the picture - part 1 n row no decrease - part 2 n row as well 1 decrease every 2 row - part 3 6 row 1 decrease every row a long slot is inserted in that part to allow soft toys hiding inside the sphere - part 4 row 1 double decrease every 2 row and 1 single decrease every other row - part 5 n row 1 double decrease every row tips to avoid markers to avoid markers at the end of each round when i use a set of 4
